alert.note: Alert for Lee; Menifee; Powell; Rowan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 10:31AM EST until February 16 at 3:30PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Bath, Elliott, Estill, Fleming, Menifee, Montgomery, Powell and Rowan. In southeast Kentucky, Lee, Morgan and Wolfe. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1025 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in some locations in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen, and rain will continue into the afternoon. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Mount Sterling, Morehead, West Liberty, Stanton, Irvine, Flemingsburg, Owingsville, Sandy Hook, Frenchburg, Marshall, Henry, Jeffersonville, Camargo, Clay City, Ravenna, Wellington, Sharpsburg, Salt Lick, Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest and Fairview. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
